text: Split Fiction is a 2025 video game. It was made by the Swedish studio Hazelight Studios and published by Electronic Arts. The game was released on March 6, 2025 for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series. == Story == The game tells the story of Mio and Zoe, two rival writers. They are trapped inside the fantasy worlds they created in their books. Players control Mio and Zoe during their journey through these imaginary worlds. == Gameplay == Split Fiction is an action-adventure cooperative video game, which means two players can play together. It cannot be played alone. The game has many different levels. Each level has its own style and rules. == Development == The game was developed by Hazelight Studios, the same studio behind A Way Out (2018) and It Takes Two (2021). Like those games, Split Fiction was published as part of the Electronic Arts program. The game was officially announced at the Game Awards in December 2024. == Reception == Split Fiction received very good reviews from both magazines and websites. The game has a Metacritic score of 90-93/100 and an OpenCritic score of 90/100. == Sales == The game sold over one million copies in the first two days. On Steam, the game had 260,000 players online at the same time during its peak. After one week, Split Fiction had sold over two million copies. == References == Category:Platform games Category:Video games developed in Sweden Category:Action-adventure games Category:Science fiction video games Category:Fantasy video games Category:Cooperative video games Category:Xbox Series X and Series S games Category:PlayStation 5 games Category:Windows games Category:Electronic Arts video games Category:3D platformers Category:2025 video games
